summaryText: What an incredible sermon about making God first in every area of our lives! Pastor Travis Hearn delivers a powerful message challenging believers to truly prioritize God in their schedule, finances, abilities, and relationships. PT breaks down the concept of 'first fruits' in a way that's both challenging and accessible, reminding us that God doesn't want to be just a slice of our life pie, but the entire filling. Can you imagine how different our lives would be if we genuinely put God first in everything? The sermon tackles tough topics like tithing with humor and grace, offering practical advice like the 90-day tithe challenge. Pastor Travis uses relatable illustrations - like cantaloupes representing income - to make complex spiritual principles easy to understand. The most powerful takeaway? God doesn't just want a part of our life; He wants to be integrated into every single aspect. Whether it's our work, our relationships, or our finances, God wants to be number one. The challenge is clear: will we allow God to truly be first, or will we continue to keep Him in a convenient little compartment? This message isn't just a sermon; it's a roadmap to experiencing God's fullest blessings.
mainPoints: Is God first in my schedule and time?
Is God first in my finances through tithing?
Is God first in my relationships?

versesMentioned.text: You shall have no other gods before me.
But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
Teach us to number our days, that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
Whatever you do, work at it with all your heart, as working for the Lord, not for human masters.
Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God's grace in its various forms.
The one who has knowledge uses words with restraint, and whoever has understanding is even-tempered.
Be sure to set aside a tenth of all that your fields produce each year, so that you may learn to revere the Lord your God always.

Bring the whole tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. Test me in this, says the Lord Almighty, and see if I will not throw open the floodgates of heaven and pour out so much blessing that there will not be room enough to store it.
A tithe of everything from the land, whether grain from the soil or fruit from the trees, belongs to the Lord; it is holy to the Lord.
Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness?

Monday.scripture: Proverbs 3:6: 'In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.'
Monday.focus: Recognizing God's guidance in daily decisions
Monday.action: Take time to intentionally pray before making any significant decisions today. Write down how you feel God is directing you.
Monday.prayer: Lord, guide my steps today. Help me to acknowledge You in every decision and trust Your direction. Open my eyes to Your leading in my life. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Matthew 6:21: 'For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.'
Tuesday.action: Review your last month's bank statement. Identify areas where you can redirect funds to honor God and support His kingdom.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, show me how I can be a better steward of the resources You've entrusted to me. Help me prioritize Your work in my financial decisions. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: 1 Corinthians 10:31: 'So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God.'
Wednesday.focus: Using talents and abilities for God's glory
Wednesday.action: Identify one skill or ability you have. Brainstorm how you can use this specifically to serve others or advance God's kingdom this week.
Wednesday.prayer: God, reveal to me how I can use my unique gifts to glorify You. Give me creativity and courage to serve others with the talents You've given me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Proverbs 13:20: 'Walk with the wise and become wise, for a companion of fools suffers harm.'
Thursday.action: Have an honest conversation with a trusted friend or mentor about the relationships in your life. Ask for their perspective on whether these relationships draw you closer to or further from God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, give me wisdom in my relationships. Help me surround myself with people who encourage my spiritual growth and challenge me to become more like You. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 12:10: 'Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves.'
Friday.action: Reach out to someone in your life who might need encouragement. Write a letter, send a text, or make a call with the intention of lifting them up.
Friday.prayer: Father, teach me to love others as You love them. Help me be an instrument of Your grace and encouragement in the lives of those around me. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Psalm 86:12: 'I will praise you, Lord my God, with all my heart; I will glorify your name forever.'
Saturday.action: Spend dedicated time in worship. Create a playlist of worship songs, journal your gratitude, or simply sit in God's presence reflecting on His goodness.
Saturday.prayer: Loving God, draw me closer to You. Help me cultivate a heart of genuine worship that goes beyond words and transforms my entire being. Be first in my life today and always. Amen.
